description.raw:
There was noticeable rendering performance degradation when moving the mouse vigorously over the 3D scene in the main window. This is because  the mouse move events continuously trigger updates to the selection buffer used for mouse picking. 

This PR reduces the selection buffer's off-screen render texture size to 1x1 pixel (originally it was the size of viewport). Updates are now a lot faster. Code adapted from rviz.

Results from testing in `test/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` on my machine:

- before: frame rate drops from ~50FPS to ~10FPS

- after: frame rate maintains at ~50FPS

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/465/) - ok

There was noticeable rendering performance degradation when moving the mouse vigorously over the 3D scene in the main window. This is because the mouse move events continuously trigger updates to the selection buffer used for mouse picking.

This PR reduces the selection buffer's off-screen render texture size to 1x1 pixel (originally it was the size of viewport). Updates are now a lot faster. Code adapted from rviz.

Results from testing in test/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world on my machine:

  • before: frame rate drops from ~50FPS to ~10FPS

  • after: frame rate maintains at ~50FPS

jenkins:

homebrew - ok

title.raw: Use single pixel selection buffer for mouse picking
